thread.title: Here is how Eagles could be on top of NFC East by next week
thread.title_full: Here is how Eagles could be on top of NFC East by next week | NJ.com

author: Eliot Shorr-Parks | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: Here is how Eagles could be on top of NFC East by next week
text:
The Eagles ' season really couldn't have started out much worse.
Quarterback Sam Bradford has been well below average for most of the season. Running back DeMarco Murray has been a nonfactor. Both staring inside linebackers, Mychal Kendricks and Kiko Alonso, have missed more time than they have played. Head coach Chip Kelly is going back to college.
But, despite all of that, they are just one game away from completely weathering the storm.
With their 39-17 win over the New Orleans Saints on Sunday, and the Giants' 30-27 win over the San Francisco 49ers Sunday night, the Eagles are now just won win away from taking over first place in the NFC East.
Here is how.
The Eagles currently stand at 2-3, the same record as the Dallas Cowboys (2-3) and Washington Redskins (2-3). The Giants (3-3) are currently in first place in the NFC East.
The Giants travel to Philadelphia next Monday night to face the Eagles at Lincoln Financial Field, giving head coach Chip Kelly's team a chance to control their own fate.
If the Eagles win, they would move to 3-3, tied with the Giants, who would drop to 3-3. A win next Monday would give the Eagles the head-to-head tie breaker over the Giants.
BRADFORD: Report card from win over Saints The Cowboys are off next Sunday, meaning they will remain 2-3 for at least another week. The Redskins travel to MetLife Stadium to face the Jets, a likely loss, which would drop them to 2-4.
Meaning if the Eagles beat the Giants, and the Jets beat the Redskins, the Eagles will be in first place in the NFC East.
While leading a weak NFC East isn't something to write home about, it would mean that despite everything that has gone wrong this season, the Eagles will be right where everyone thought they would be six weeks into the season -- on top of the division.
